meanings: (자리에서) get up, stand up, (formal) rise (up / to one's feet); (누워 있다가 앉다) sit up; (넘어졌다가) pick oneself up; (자리...
(잠자리에서) get up, get out of bed, (formal) rise; (잠에서 깨다) wake up, (literary) awake
occur, (일·사건 등이) happen, take place, come up, arise; (우연히) come about; (전쟁·싸움 등이) break out, erupt

meanings.meaning: A lot of water has flowed under the bridge (since then).

examples.korean: Flashes of light were followed by an explosion. 발음듣기 번쩍이는 불빛들에 뒤이어 폭발이 일어났다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Flashes of light were followed by an explosion. 발음

examples.korean: The injection sent his leg into spasm. 발음듣기 그 주사를 맞자 그의 다리에 경련이 일어났다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: She leapt out of bed. 발음듣기 그녀는 서둘러 침대에서 일어났다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: It happened late last year. 발음듣기 그것은 작년 말에 일어났다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary

examples.korean: Discontent among the ship’s crew finally led to the outbreak of mutiny. 발음듣기 그 배의 선원들 사이에 있던 불만이 터져 마침내 폭동이 일어났다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
